snippet: Evidence based on cellphone records has led to hundreds of convictions in the Gujarat State riots, and India has yet to experience another large-scale paroxysm of sectarian violence.
abstract: Justice is slowly being achieved a decade after the riots in Gujarat State, where Hindu mobs slaughtered nearly 1,000 people, mostly Muslims, while police stood by; cellphone records have led to hundreds of convictions, and India has yet to experience another large-scale paroxysm of sectarian violence.
lead_paragraph: Evidence based on cellphone records has led to hundreds of convictions in the Gujarat State riots, and India has yet to experience another large-scale paroxysm of sectarian violence.

headline.seo: Gujarat Riot Trials May Alter India’s Cycle of Violence
headline.main: Justice and ‘a Ray of Hope’ After 2002 India Riots
